definition: to appoint
same as 逶 in 逶迤 winding, curved
surname Wei
to entrust/to cast aside/to shift (blame etc)/to accumulate/roundabout/winding/dejected/listless/committee member/council/end/actually/certainly
surname Ren/Ren County 任縣|任县[Ren2 Xian4] in Hebei

to assign/to appoint/to take up a post/office/responsibility/to let/to allow/to give free rein to/no matter (how, what etc)/classifier for terms served in office, or for spouses, girlfriends etc (as in 前任男友)
letter of appointment
mandate (territory administration)

sentences.english: A captain in the Navy ranks above a captain in the Army.
sentences.chinese: 美國陸軍上尉或海軍上校有由總統簽名的委任狀。

sentences.english: The Shareholder shall cause the Company to report such appointment to the original examination and approval authority for the record.
sentences.chinese: 股東應責成公司將該委任報原審批機關備案。
傑克被委任爲聯合主席。

sentences.english: She was the first CIO appointed for the University of North Carolina system.
sentences.chinese: 她是北卡羅萊納大學委任的首位CIO。

sentences.english: She is appointed to the vice- chairmanship of the committee.
sentences.chinese: 她被委任爲委員會副主席。

sentences.english: We have commission bureau opcommodity inspection and quarantine( bcc) to conduct inspection.
sentences.chinese: 我們已委任商品檢查和檢疫機構進行驗貨。

sentences.english: They appoint precinct election judges and other election-day officials.
sentences.chinese: 他們委任選舉區的評判員及在大選日工作的官員。

sentences.english: The Group has not given any power of attorney which remains in force.
sentences.chinese: 該集團尚未發行任何仍然保持其有效性的委任書。

sentences.english: In February 2004, he was appointed head of Shaw College.
sentences.chinese: 二零零四年二月，程教授獲委任爲逸夫書院院長。

sentences.english: If you appoint us as your general agent, the turnover will be greatly increased.
sentences.chinese: 如果你方能委任我方爲總經理，營業額將大幅度增長。

sentences.english: The  committee admits it  committed an  omission in  commissioning the  mission.
sentences.chinese: 委員會承認它在委任使團時犯的疏忽。

sentences.english: But the system of appointment would be abandoned in the modern society after all.
sentences.chinese: 但是委任制畢竟要被現代社會所拋棄。

sentences.english: They are also named as Appointed Examiners.
sentences.chinese: 他們亦稱爲委任檢驗師。

sentences.english: He can sign agreements with foreign governments and approve ambassadorial appointments. On bigger issues he defers to the Supreme Leader.
sentences.chinese: 總統可以和外國政府簽訂合約，批准委任大使。

sentences.english: The President heads the executive branch and appoints the cabinet.
sentences.chinese: 總統親自領導行政部門並且委任內閣。

sentences.english: Chief Executive Tung Chee-hwa was yesterday appointed as a delegate to the Chinese People's Political Consultative Conference.
sentences.chinese: 特首董建華昨日獲委任爲全國政協的港區委員。

definition: to appoint/(job) appointment/CL:紙|纸[zhi3]
to appoint
to set apart/to assign sb to a job
to be promoted to
post/position/job/duties
to hold several jobs at once/concurrent post/working part-time
to act as a substitute/to act on sb's behalf
to give orders
to promote (sb)/to upgrade/to ascend
to take over (as minister, manager etc)
to take up a post/to start in a new job
to take office/to assume a post
to transfer/to move to another post
key job/important position
newly-appointed/newly elected/new (in a political office)
to remove sb from their post/to dismiss
